definitions.definition: The concluding section of a discourse , either written or oral, in which the orator or writer sums up and commends his topic to his audience, particularly as used in the technical sense of a component of ancient Roman oratorical delivery.
A discourse or rhetorical argument in general.

main_definition: The concluding section of a discourse , either written or oral, in which the orator or writer sums up and commends his topic to his audience, particularly as used in the technical sense of a component of ancient Roman oratorical delivery.
secondary_definitions: A discourse or rhetorical argument in general.
